alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; McClain; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 6:44AM CDT until July 09 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHEASTERN CLEVELAND, SOUTHEASTERN MCCLAIN, SOUTHWESTERN POTTAWATOMIE, NORTHERN PONTOTOC AND SOUTHERN SEMINOLE COUNTIES... At 644 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Purcell, Noble, Slaughterville, Wewoka, Lexington, Konawa, Byng, Maud, Bowlegs, Asher, Tribbey, Wanette, Francis, St. Louis, Sasakwa, Etowah and Trousdale. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
